Sequence Information.Peptide Name: cd4 (cyclic dimeric KR-12, synthetic AMPs, UCBB1; Derivative: ld4*)
Sequence Information.Source: designed, human cathelicidin analog, animal-derived, natural derivative

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that this sequence is similar (93.75%) tocd3K: 13%, R: 20%, I=G: 13%.Activity:  active against E. coli (MIC 5 uM), P. aeruginosa (MIC 10 uM), S. aureus (MIC 10 uM), and C. albicans (MIC 5 uM). Warning: Non-standard assay.SAR: the linear form of this peptide has activity similar to the cyclic form.In vitro toxicity: human RBC, HC50 >40 uM.Peptide stability: over 50% remaining in 25% serum after 6 h.Structure:  random coil in buffer and helical in lysophosphatidylglycerol.
Literature Information.Author: Gunasekera S, Muhammad T, Strömstedt AA, Rosengren KJ, Göransson U.2020
Literature Information.Title: Backbone Cyclization and Dimerization of LL-37-Derived Peptides Enhance Antimicrobial Activity and Proteolytic Stability.
